A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: A big scope undertaking that took risk and evolved characters. It had everything a Star Wars film should. Cheers\, geers\, cheese\, and yes please... It had some of the biggest shots to date. It also had a scene or two that meant or added absolutely nothing. Nothing is perfect. I especially like the plot twist and the overall theme to \"let the past die\" Which I notice a lot of reviewers are having a hard time doing. The best part was finally exposing the Jedi for who they were. Woo Woo salesmen. I give it an A-.
